column4: is it possible to have ubuntu automatically disable compiz after so long of idleness?
You could do that with a script I presume
i have a laptop that requires "i915.modeset=1" to boot, but when i try to boot with flash drive it doesnt set the mode correctly
what did you mean by its set by default?
I mean the default is already i915.modeset=1
then why is that not in /etc/default/grub after "quiet splash" ?
i'm the n00b here but youre wrong, its not there by default
That is strange if you have to manually enable it on recent versions of ubuntu
i've ALWAYS had to manually add it to get this to boot
I have no idea why you would have to enable modesetting manually to make it work then
Are you sure its an i9xx intel chip?
strange. Maybe something disables KMS on some chips
Did you check the md5sum for the image you put on the flash drive?
